ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Verant's new security policy..
ygData.msgSnippet: Oh, I thought it was permanent banning.. I hadn t thought about that. luv, -Su How else are they going to keep the person who stole the account from giving all
ygData.messageBody:
Oh, I thought it was permanent banning..
I hadn't thought about that.
luv,
-Su

How else are they going to keep the person who stole the account from giving
all of the rightful owner's gear away? If they ban it so he can't play it,
then he can't strip the characters.

----- Original Message -----
From: Fredrik Persson
Sent: Wednesday, June 13, 2001 7:46 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EverQuest] Verant's new security policy..

What do you all think of this? Verant says the investigations on compromised
accounts take away too much time for the GMs to do customer support, so now
they are just going to ban all accounts that are compromised.. That's what I
call really f-in BAD customer support.. It's like an insurance.. Knowing
that if someone steals your car, or breaks into it and steal your brand new
Lodizal Shell Stereo, the insurance company will help you out and cough up a
new one for you.. Verant sux! Maybe they could charge a fee like the
insurance companies do, from people whos accounts have been compromised in
order to investigate and rectify the situation, but BAN THEM? That is SO
F-IN WRONG!

- Avron K'Nighit - Paladin 48
- Dunbar Keglifter - Cleric 59
- Meron Shadowdale - Rogue 53


Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
